summary: By the grace of God, Tiwa44 & Gothpunk4Christ I bring to you the legendary SPICE GEAR. Now in glorious CBBE with full bodyslide support included.
descriptionHtml:
[size=3]This is a conversion of UNP Spice Gear to CBBE bodies. One of the best vanilla armor overhauls. Originally created by Tiwa44, also hosted for SSE by Gothpunk4Christ.

Check out their stuff here:
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/68028]UNP Spice Gear Collection by Tiwa44
[/url]﻿[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/11687]UNP and UNPB Spice Gear Collection by Gothpunk4Christ
[/url]﻿
These great people have granted me permission to use their work and thus I went ahead and tweaked some things in bodyslide. It took a lot of coffee and nerves and time but it's done. It's done. Enjoy.[/size]

[size=4][b]FEATURES[/b]
[size=3]-Replacer for vanilla armors
-All vanilla armors (no clothing) remade for a more sexy look
-Full bodyslide support included
-Weights placed where appropriate[/size]

[b]INSTALLATION[/b]
[size=3]-Download and install with a mod manager of your choice
-Alternatively download and extract the mod to Skyrim's data folder[/size]

[b]RECOMMENDED MODS[/b]
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/24909][size=3]aMidianBorn Book of Silence[/size]
[/url][size=3][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/13207]CBP Physics
[/url]﻿[/size][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/64981][size=3]A Closer Look[/size]
[/url]
[b]FAQ[/b]
[size=3]-Why no clothing?
It will be uploaded as a separate mod like the original.

-How do I bodyslide?
1) Install bodyslide
2) Install my mod
3) Open bodyslide, choose groups (top middle) and select CBBE Spice Gear Full
4) Pick a body preset you like
5) Click Batch Build (with ctrl if you want a custom directory!)
6) Add the newly built meshes to the game and enjoy

-No Gigist that's too hard help :(
You don't need to use bodyslide. I've prebuilt the armors in CBBE curvy so you can just DL the mod and play.

-They don't jiggle?
Solid metal doesn't jiggle but the more bikini-style armors will. I added weights to the armors where I felt it was natural. If there's a lot of demand for a full jiggly setup I can revisit the armors. The clothing (Minidresses mod) will bounce naturally.

-I see clipping.
Uh MAYBE. I spent a week learning and tweaking stuff and in the end I scrapped my near week long work and rebuilt the thing from scratch. I didn't go through every armor using all kinds of angles to test the clipping. I'll update the set as I go. Post a comment and I can check out the worst offenders. Mostly they should be fine already.

-Why always a FAQ?
Idk. All the cool kids got one so I wanted one too.

-Is this where we begin to chat and not actually do a real FAQ?
Usually yeah.
[/size]
[b]PERMISSIONS[/b]
None granted. The assets of this mod belong to the original author Tiwa44 so whatever you want to do, you must get his authorization for any modifications/anything else.

[center][size=6][b]NO REUPLOADS

THIS IS NEXUS EXCLUSIVE[/b][/size][/center]

[b]CREDITS
[/b][size=3]Bethesda for Skyrim[/size]
[/size][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/3347902]Tiwa44[/url]﻿ for allowing me to use his awesome work
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/users/438513]Gothpunk4Christ[/url] for allowing me to use his SSE version of Tiwa44's mod
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/users/3330686]Caliente[/url] & [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/users/4291759]Ousnius[/url]﻿ for all their hard work on [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/201]Bodyslide and Outfit Studio[/url] and everything else
author: Gigist
